Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the attack on the homeless veteran did not take place in 2016 and was not related to anti-Trump protests.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the involvement of anti-Trump protesters in the attack, as it falsely attributes the incident to the protests.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to prove that anti-Trump protesters were responsible for the attack.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the attack on the homeless veteran was directly linked to the anti-Trump protests without providing substantial evidence.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to acknowledge the alternative explanation that the attack on the homeless veteran was a result of a disagreement over pumping gas, as reported by the Philadelphia Inquirer.
